intro: Biophytum reinwardtii subsp. abyssinicum, commonly known as the Abyssinian fireplant, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It is characterized by its striking, bright red or orange inflorescences that resemble flames, which appear during the dry season. The plant has fleshy, succulent leaves that help it store water, adapting it to arid environments. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
